text: Bernard Mathez was a Swiss footballer who played in the late 1940s. He played as Striker. Mathez joined Basel's first team during their 1946–47 season under team manager Anton Schall. Mathez played his domestic league debut for the club in the away game on 1 September 1946 as Basel won 2–0 against Locarno. He scored his first goal for his club one week later on 8 September in the home game at the Landhof against Young Boys. In fact he scored two goals as Basel won 8–1. In the two seasons that he played with the club, Mathez played a total of 13 games for Basel scoring a total of five goals. Ten of these games were in the Nationalliga A, one in the Swiss Cup and two were friendly games. He scored four goals in the domestic league and the other was scored during the test games. After his time with Basel Mathez moved on and played at least two seasons with Cantonal Neuchatel who at that time played in the Nationalliga B ==References== ==Sources== * Rotblau: Jahrbuch Saison 2017/2018.
